Instance.description: Anchored social groups revolve around an object. The Sims running the social are usually bound by constraints that are more restrictive than the social constraint itself, e.g. a posture constraint. Anchored social group have the following specific functionality: * Sims in this group do not run any 'get close' behavior. Instead, they route directly to their final constraint. * The anchor object of this group is the 'picked object' of the initiating social super interaction. The picked object is the target of the pushing picker interaction. This group *must* be created as part of a picker -> social interaction flow. * The constraint for this group are always centered around the anchor object. They are never adjusted based on Sims joining/leaving. Sims never attempt to adjust.
